lg.l: The double sorow of Troilus to tellen
That was kyng Pryamys sonne of Troye
In lovyng how his aventuris fellen
Frome wo to wele ⁊and afftir ward oute of Ioye
My purpose is or I parte you froye
Thesiphon þᵘou helpe me for to endite
These wofuƚƚ wordes þat wepyn as I write
To the clepe I thou goddesse of turmente
Thou cruel · wighte that sorowist eủer in peyne
Helpe me that am the sorye Instrumente
That helpith lovers as I can to pleyne
For wel it sitt the soth for to seyne
Vn to a wofuƚƚ wighte a drery chere
And to a sory tale a sory chere
For I þat god of louys ʆseruᵃntꝭes serve
Ne dare to love for myn vnliklynesse
Pray for spede though I shulde sterve
So ferre I am frome his helpe in derknesse
But natheles myght I do yit gladnesse
To my lover or my love availe
Have he thanke ⁊and myn be the travaile
But þe lovers that bathen in gladnesse
If any drope of pitee in you be
Remembre you for olde passid heuynesse
For goddis love and on the adủersitee
That other suffren̄ thynke how somtyme þat ye
Fownde how love durst you displese
Or ellis ye wonne it with grete ease
And preyth for them that been in the caas
Of Troylus as ye may afftir here
That love them bryng in hevyn to solaas
And for me praieth þat god so deere
He yeve me myghte to shewe in some manere
Some peyn or woo suche as lovis folke endure
In troylus vnseely auenture
